TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventHandler(object sender, DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventArgs)
public delegate void DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DesignerActionUIStateChangeEventArgs ^ e);

summary.span: Representa el método que controlará el evento de .

span.span: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks El modelo de evento en el [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] se basa en tener un delegado de eventos que se conecta un evento con su controlador.The event model in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] is based on having an event delegate that connects an event with its handler. Para generar un evento, se necesitan dos elementos:To raise a event, two elements are needed: - El (clase), derivado de , que contiene los datos del evento.The class, derived from , which holds the event data. - El delegado, que señala a un método que proporciona la respuesta al evento.The delegate, which points to a method that provides the response to the event. Cuando se crea un delegado , se identifica el método que controlará el evento.When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. Para asociar el evento al controlador, se debe agregar una instancia del delegado al evento.To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Siempre que se produce el evento, se llama a su controlador, a menos que se quite el delegado.The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. Para obtener más información sobre los delegados de controladores de eventos, vea [controlar y provocar eventos](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
